title: Funa Tonaki
text:
Funa Tonaki (渡名喜 風南 "Tonaki Fūna", born 1 August 1995) is a Japanese <a href="judoka">judoka</a>. She won a silver medal in <a href="Judo%20at%20the%202020%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Women%27s%2048%20kg">Women's Judo 48 kg</a>, at the <a href="2020%20Summer%20Olympics">2020 Summer Olympics</a> held in Tokyo, Japan.
Career.
In 2015, she won the gold medal at the World Junior Championships in <a href="Abu%20Dhabi">Abu Dhabi</a>. She won the gold medal at the <a href="2017%20World%20Judo%20Championships">2017 World Judo Championships</a> in <a href="Budapest">Budapest</a> by defeating top seed <a href="Galbadrakhyn%20Otgontsetseg">Galbadrakhyn Otgontsetseg</a> in the semi-final and former world champion <a href="M%C3%B6nkhbatyn%20Urantsetseg">Mönkhbatyn Urantsetseg</a> in the final.
In 2021, she won the silver medal in her event at the <a href="2021%20Judo%20World%20Masters">2021 Judo World Masters</a> held in Doha, Qatar
